tophersmith.security.headers.impl

Class XFrameOptionsHeader

  • java.lang.Object
    • tophersmith.security.headers.impl.AbstractHeader
      • tophersmith.security.headers.impl.XFrameOptionsHeader

  • public class XFrameOptionsHeader
extends AbstractHeader
    The X-Frame-Options header is used in response headers to configure which sites may frame this response's resource. This defends against UI Redress attacks such as Clickjacking
    Author:
    Chris Smith

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      XFrameOptionsHeader()
      Constructs a new X-Frame-Options Header object By default, sets the header to SAMEORIGIN

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String buildHeaderValue()
      Constructs a String representation of the value of this header.
      XFrameOptionsHeader setAllowFrom(String origin)
      sets the header to ALLOW-FROM with the given parameter
      XFrameOptionsHeader setDeny()
      sets the header to DENY
      XFrameOptionsHeader setSameOrigin()
      sets the header to SAMEORIGIN
      void validate()
      If Allow-From is used, a valid origin must also be set
